required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: HX575 Epoetin Alfa Subcutaneously (s.c.) in Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD)
clinical_study.official_title: Open Label, Single Arm, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Safety and Immunogenicity of HX575 Epoetin Alfa in the Treatment of Anemia Associated With Chronic Kidney Disease in Pre-dialysis and Dialysis Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The study will assess the immunogenicity, safety, and efficacy of HX575 epoetin alfa administered subcutaneously (s.c.) in patients suffering from anemia due to chronic kidney disease (CKD)

primary_outcome.description: The incidence of antibody formation against epoetin in Radio-immuno-precipitation (RIP) assay

secondary_outcome.measure: Hemoglobin Level and Change From Baseline Period at Visit 16 (End of Study)
secondary_outcome.description: Actual values of hemoglobin levels at end of study visit and change from Baseline Period (Week -4 to Week -1)

intervention.description: Eligible patients are scheduled to receive HX575 (INN: Epoetin alfa) as a solution for injection in order to achieve or maintain the correction of renal anemia.
intervention.other_name: Binocrit®, Epoetin alfa HEXAL®, Novicrit®, Abseamed®

criteria.textblock:
Main Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult male and female patients w or w/o dialysis treatment
- Stable i.v. or s.c. maintenance therapy with an EU-approved ESA treatment or ESA naïve.
- Adequate iron substitution
Main Exclusion Criteria:
- History of Pure Red Cell Aplasia (PRCA) or anti-erythropoietin (EPO) antibodies
- Contraindications for ESA therapy
- Serum albumin < 3.0 g/dL
- Immunocompromized patients (immunosuppressive treatment, chemotherapy)
- Hepatitis C infection on an active treatment or hepatitis B or human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) infection
- Systemic lupus erythematosus
- Symptomatic congestive heart failure, Unstable angina pectoris, or myocardial infarction within 6 months
- History of malignancy of any organ system within the last 5 years
- History of use of any non-EU approved ESA

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Patients, suffering from anemia associated with chronic Kidney Disease (CKD), were treated s.c. with HX575 at least once per week in order to achieve and maintain Hb concentration within the target range of 10.0 to 12.0 g/dL. 417 patients were enrolled.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Male and female patients (ESA [Erythropoiesis Stimulating Agent]-naïve/on ESA-maintenance therapy, i.v./s.c.) aged 18 years/older, suffering from anemia assoc. with CKD, with/without dialysis treatment. Anemia: Mean Hb conc. <= 11.0 g/dL for ESA naïve, 9.0-12.0 g/dL for patients receiving ESA therapy.

group.title: HX575, Safety Population
group.description: In the single arm study, HX575 was tested as investigational medicinal product. The single arm includes ESA-naïve patients and patients on ESA-maintenance therapy.

baseline.population: Safety population: The safety population consists of all patients that received at least one dose of study drug

group.title: HX575, Safety Population
group.description: The Study was designed as single arm study with HX575 tested as investigational medicinal product. The safety population (SAF) consisted of all patients that received at least one dose of study drug. 417 patients enrolled, 416 treated. Group includes ESA-naïve patients and patients on ESA-maintenance therapy.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: ESA pre-treatment
measure.description: A patient is considered to be ESA naïve if the patient did not receive any ESA therapy within 2 months prior to first screening visit.

outcome.title: Anti-Erythropoietin (EPO) Antibodies
outcome.description: The incidence of antibody formation against epoetin in Radio-immuno-precipitation (RIP) assay
outcome.population: Safety population: The safety population consists of all patients that received at least one dose of study drug

group.title: HX575
group.description: HX575 administered s.c. at least once per week. During the treatment period the dose was individually titrated to maintain hemoglobin levels between 10.0 and 12.0 g/dL

measure.title: Anti-Erythropoietin (EPO) Antibodies
measure.description: The incidence of antibody formation against epoetin in Radio-immuno-precipitation (RIP) assay
measure.population: Safety population: The safety population consists of all patients that received at least one dose of study drug

analysis.estimate_desc: Incidence rate is based on duration of treatment period (years)

outcome.title: Hemoglobin Level and Change From Baseline Period at Visit 16 (End of Study)
outcome.description: Actual values of hemoglobin levels at end of study visit and change from Baseline Period (Week -4 to Week -1)
outcome.population: Per-protocol population (all patients that received at least one dose of study drug) with non-missing Hemoglobin value at Visit 16 (end of study).

group.title: HX575 - ESA Naive
group.description: HX575 administered s.c. at least once per week. During the treatment period the dose was individually titrated to maintain hemoglobin levels between 10.0 and 12.0 g/dL. At study start patients were either ESA (Erythropoiesis Stimulating Agent) naive or on ESA maintenance treatment. This group only contains patients that were ESA naive at study start, e.g. did not receive any ESA dose within 2 months prior to first screening visit.

group.title: HX575 - ESA Maintenance
group.description: HX575 administered s.c. at least once per week. During the treatment period the dose was individually titrated to maintain hemoglobin levels between 10.0 and 12.0 g/dL. At study start patients were either ESA (Erythropoiesis Stimulating Agent) naive or on ESA maintenance treatment. This group only contains patients that were on ESA maintenance treatment at study start, e.g. did receive at least one dose of commercial ESA treatment within 2 months prior to first screening visit.

group.title: HX575
group.description: HX575 administered s.c. at least once per week. During the treatment period the dose was individually titrated to maintain hemoglobin levels between 10.0 and 12.0 g/dL.

measure.title: Hemoglobin Level and Change From Baseline Period at Visit 16 (End of Study)
measure.description: Actual values of hemoglobin levels at end of study visit and change from Baseline Period (Week -4 to Week -1)
measure.population: Per-protocol population (all patients that received at least one dose of study drug) with non-missing Hemoglobin value at Visit 16 (end of study).

group.title: HX575, Safety Population
group.description: Study was designed as single arm study with HX575 tested as investigational medicinal product. Safety population includes ESA therapy naïve patients and ESA maintenance patients. Shown are all AEs including non-treatment related AEs.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Sponsor shall have the right to the first publication or presentation of the results of the study which is intended to be a joint, multi-center publication of the study results. Following the first publication, institutions and/or Principal Investigators may publish or present data or results from the study per the terms of the clinical trial agreement.
